trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Spring CM | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Spring CM | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Spring CM with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Spring CM with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show how to set up single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and SpringCM.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show how to set up single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and SpringCM.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A SpringCM single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A SpringCM single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure Active Directory users you have assigned to SpringCM will be able to single sign-on using the AAD Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure Active Directory users you have assigned to SpringCM will be able to single sign-on using the AAD Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for SpringCM
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for SpringCM

trans-unit.source: Configuring Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SpringCM.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SpringCM.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type SpringCM.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type SpringCM.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select SpringCM, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select SpringCM, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SpringCM</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SpringCM</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to SpringCM with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to SpringCM with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the SpringCM application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the SpringCM application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to SpringCM page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to SpringCM page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the SpringCM Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your SpringCM application, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the SpringCM Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your SpringCM application, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: The app URL is your SpringCM tenant URL (e.g.: https://na11.springcm.com/atlas/SSO/SSOEndpoint.ashx?aid=16826):
trans-unit.target: The app URL is your SpringCM tenant URL (e.g.: https://na11.springcm.com/atlas/SSO/SSOEndpoint.ashx?aid=16826):

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at SpringCM page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally to your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at SpringCM page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally to your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, sign on to your SpringCM company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, sign on to your SpringCM company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click GO TO, click Preferences, and then, in the Account Preferences section, click SAML SSO.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click GO TO, click Preferences, and then, in the Account Preferences section, click SAML SSO.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML SSO</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML SSO</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Identity Provider Configuration section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Identity Provider Configuration section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Identity Provider Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Identity Provider Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded Azure Active Directory certificate, click Select Issuer Certificate or Change Issuer Certificate.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded Azure Active Directory certificate, click Select Issuer Certificate or Change Issuer Certificate.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SpringCM page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SpringCM page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SpringCM page, copy the Singel Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Service Provider (SP) Initiated Endpoint textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SpringCM page, copy the Singel Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Service Provider (SP) Initiated Endpoint textbox.

trans-unit.source: As SAML Enabled, select Enable.
trans-unit.target: As SAML Enabled, select Enable.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure Active Directory users to log into SpringCM, they must be provisioned into SpringCM.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure Active Directory users to log into SpringCM, they must be provisioned into SpringCM.

trans-unit.source: In the case of SpringCM, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of SpringCM, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>Create and Edit a SpringCM User</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>Create and Edit a SpringCM User</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Log in to your SpringCM company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your SpringCM company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click GOTO, and then click Address Book.
trans-unit.target: Click GOTO, and then click Address Book.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Create User.
trans-unit.target: Click Create User.

trans-unit.source: Select a User Role.
trans-unit.target: Select a User Role.

trans-unit.source: Select Send Activation Email.
trans-unit.target: Select Send Activation Email.

trans-unit.source: Type the first name, last name and email address of a valid Azure Active Directory user account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the first name, last name and email address of a valid Azure Active Directory user account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Add the user to a Security group.
trans-unit.target: Add the user to a Security group.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other SpringCM user account creation tools or APIs provided by SpringCM to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other SpringCM user account creation tools or APIs provided by SpringCM to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the SpringCM application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the SpringCM application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
